author: Peter A Stone
comment: Stunning

author: A Google User
comment: One of the neatest apps I've ever seen! The developer is responsive and the new features are fun. This is the only widget that stays on my home screen year after year!

author: Aaron Moore
comment: This is the one, of you need a 24 hour watch/clock widget for your home screen. It's great for reminding you how little daylight you have, in the winter. By default 12 is on top, which is the best design. You can switch it in the settings. You have to go to settings to make it read 0-24 instead of twice 1-12, around the dial.

author: Helga S.
comment: A beautiful way to follow the time in different parts of the world. The developer has always been extremely helpful and takes care of his customers. I've owned the app for many years now and I still love it from the day I bought it. A little masterpiece.

author: A Google User
comment: Love this app. As a pilot I'm in need of knowing when sunrise and sunset is each day, plus this app is super fun to play with a the settings. Works fine on my nougat phone and lollipop tablet

author: A Google User
comment: A cool clock which allows you to see the solar highlights of the day visually. Nice to also see that the clock feature has got a new beautiful design. I wish there was physical wall clocks like it.

author: Pamela Crawford
comment: This is so beautiful, amazing and practical. I love wowing my friends & strangers with ,its  magic. Been a fan from the beginning. Thanks for such a wondrous app....instant perspective.

author: Chris Pugh
comment: After a few such apps, this one now has my favourite 24-hour dial face. The wave-style one is neat, too.

author: Dick Cook
comment: Superb visual. I love the globe!

author: Matthew Heinen
comment: Amazing.  It's set as my live wallpaper on my phone.  I can see clouds over me from space... Has a clock type dial that shows the time, moon position and cycle, sunrise and sunset, etc.  Sitting on my phone display over the live wallpaper.  So cool. Can't remember if I had to buy this or not, but  worth at least 5 bucks.

author: A Google User
comment: This app remains on the 'main screen' of my phone.  I just love being able to see how much daylight I have left, whether there'll be moonlight, and just generally feel the analogue flow of a day.   This is especially useful for doing outdoorsy things - especially for keeping track when you need to be thinking about pitching your tent, because doing so in the dark is no fun.

author: gle
comment: This is an ingenious app! I have paid apps like Solunar, & tried the others. This is by far the best. I've had Terra Time for over a year & it's so good I had to come back to write this review.

author: James Poole
comment: Beautiful application. I wanted a clock with 24hrs to a circuit (I put a conventional digital clock on the other home screen).  This is perfect. Works well with: Oneplus Two "One A2003", Android 7.1.2, Lineage 14.1

author: Pieter Wycoff
comment: I don't regret paying for this app at all. It has a lot of information which is displayed beautifully. An all around great app!

author: Joseph
comment: Great app, gives all the important data regarding sun, daylight length, and moon. Good visual representations. Could be improved for photographers by including the Blue and Yellow hours, perhaps.

author: Monty Wild
comment: Pretty good, lots of good features, but needs a flat world map daylight clock widget.

author: A Google User
comment: Wow. One of the first apps I have ever purchased back in 2010. Still use this app occasionally to check length of day change rate and stuff

author: Moses u Mwangi
comment: This app used to have live weather clouds update but this feature is no longer available.the clouds have not been updated for several months.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Live clouds ARE still available: have you configured the app to show them? In the first page of TerraTime's Settings is one called "Work offline"; selecting "Never" will tell the app to go online to download the latest imagery available.

comment: This app is an awesome and excellent display of the earth during the day and night and seasons. I like it!

author: Waleed Al-Shaikhli
comment: There are few bugs

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. I fix bugs that I know about, so if there are particular ones that are bothering you, it'd be best to tell me about them specifically. There's an email link in the app's About screen...

author: A Google User
comment: Amazingly cool app. Subject to network and imagery quality issues, but these are rare. I have the map as my wallpaper, love it.  Six years later, I have to say, this app just keeps getting better. It's been on my must install list since day one. Highly recommend it as a clock, as a global weather map, as a world clock, and...well, you get the idea.  My one request would be, for the live wallpaper, to allow the earth to be moved to any part of the screen(s), not pinned in the center. I'd really like to be able to move it down to the lower left, sort of between the main screen and the adjacent one.

author: Neo TheWon
comment: Bad frame rate. I have OnePlus 3T. Should easily get 60FPS. This lags like 20 FPS on my home screen wallpaper. Needs to be optimised. An option to adjust performance and battery savings will be great. An FPS slider too!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: This is a deliberate decision: higher frame rates use more battery, and on a live wallpaper, this can be significant. We'll consider adding an option to let you change this yourself.

author: A.J Mathew
comment: Please add gyroscope sensitivity levels in settings. The globe is oversensitive even to slight movements, which is less appealing visually. And it would be helpful if there is a guide to watch face settings. As for the rest of the app, absolutely loving it. 5 stars once it is fixed!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: The gyroscope experience varies from device to device, and it's about more than just a single "sensitivity" level. Nonetheless, we'll look into adding a setting for this in a future update - thanks!

author: Rodger Bird
comment: One of my favorite apps. I have been a fan of Sun terminator programs ever since the old DOS program GeoClock. The "Globe" view, "Map" view (showing Sun and Moon location) and the "Camera View (Beta)" that plots the path of the sun and moon are really useful features. The Clock and Clock widgets are well done allowing you to pick Classic, Material, or Wave views. I like the Wave view.

author: Nicolas B
comment: Great to see this app still being supported by the dev, also pleased to see the augmented sun / moon thing works well so thank you

author: Bernie
comment: This is a truly ingenious set of views and clocks.   The clocks are essentially interesting, the amount of astronomical information that's displayed with grace and apparent ease, set clocks above most interfaces.   I also enjoy the live wallpapers.

author: Michael Arroyo
comment: Absolutely great app. Just wish it had a watchface for Samsung Gear S2. It seems like this should be an easy feature for them to configure. Earn that last star!  ..prompt and well explained response earned the extra star!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Unfortunately, it's not easy at all; Gear S2 uses a different OS and so would require completely rewriting the relevant portions of the app. However, you can get the TerraTime widgets as your watch face on the S2 by using the Wearable Widgets app.

author: Michael Lawrie
comment: I would love it much more if it had current location tide times and data too... It would fit well.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Although tides are intrinsically linked to the moon's (and sun's) gravitational pull, accurate tide times involve much more, being greatly influenced by the configuration of local waterways. As such, adding tides to TerraTime would greatly increase the size and complexity of the app.

author: Abu Wawda
comment: I purchased this app a long time ago and it's still working great!

author: Cristina Hughes
comment: I really love this app,but I cannot find the camera view mode.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Unfortunately, it looks like your Viking Pro tablet doesn't have a hardware compass, which is necessary to make this feature work. Please email us directly if you think this is in error and we'll work to fix it.

author: Sentinel UK
comment: Great app. It would be useful if it could display a graph for sunrise/sunset times etc. over a period of time.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: This is something that I've considered doing for a while. I'll register your vote in favor of it - thanks!

author: Jason Hart
comment: Clouds never update. Disappointing.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: To get live clouds, go to Settings and change "Work Offline". Many users of the app are more concerned with bandwidth usage than cloud updates!

author: A Google User
comment: This app is so much fun to use. I love the map wallpaper. Thanks guys for your program.

author: Munish Taneja
comment: Live wallpaper was awesome on my S5 and S7 Edge

author: London Wolfe
comment: Was great till widgets quit working

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: We're not seeing any trouble with widgets here - and we can't fix a problem we can't see. If you email with more details on what's going wrong (there's a link in the app's About screen), we'll do our best to resolve it. Thanks!

author: Heather Thompson
comment: It's a great app If it had the tide predictions  it would be perfect!

author: G Walsh
comment: Love the app, wish it could show UTC time as well

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion! I'll look at doing this for a future release of the app.

author: Dylan McGannon
comment: Looking forward to more AW watch faces!

author: Thomas Perkins
comment: I wish I could have option to tap on the widget and it do nothing and or option to slide the information inside the widget to see past, present and future. Other than its kinda fuzzy in terms of the widget telling exact information it's quite good.

author: Erik Bosman
comment: Superbly awesome 😁 small suggestion, it would be nice to be able to have a digital clock on the wear watch face.
